bibl.title: Letter from Walter Reed to Emilie Lawrence Reed, [September 15?, 1902]

div1.p: Reed writes about his conference with O'Reilly from the War Department. Kean and his family are moving-in nearby. He comments on Smart becoming the Chief Surgeon of the Philippines.

div1.head: Letter from Walter Reed to Emilie Lawrence Reed, [September 15?, 1902]
div1.p:
you see, at a
glance, that I am hard up for
a scrap of paper on which to
write. I haven't a sheet on
hand, but will get some tomorrow-
Kean & I are going to walk over
to Miss Mason's on Thomas' Circle,
for our dinner & are then going
right down to the War Dept.
to have a conference with Dr
O'Reilly, so that I am trying to get
a word written before we go to
dinner- Had a pleasant trip
down the Mountain & got home in
good time to go to bed by 10.30 --
slept like a top all night- Mrs.
Kean left for Virginia, this
morning. They have decided to
take the flat if Dr Kober will
waive the clause about the ba-
bies, and I am sure that he will.
It will be so nice to have such lovely
neighbors- What do you think?
Col. Smart has been offered
the Chief-Surgeoncy in the Phil-
ippines & accepted. Did you
ever quite hear of such a
thing? I think the Smart family
will have a good time in Manila.
Here comes Dr Cabell in his
automobile & invites us down to
the club to dinner. So I musn't miss
that chance- Goodbye- Love & kisses
to my sweet baby girls-
